episode_summary: This episode features discussions on ancient human species, mundane science fiction, unusual embalming practices, and the dietary preferences of wasps. The hosts are joined by guest Ella Alshamahi, who shares insights into paleoanthropology and her new series.

facts.fact: 50,000 years ago, humans the size of penguins hunted elephants the size of cows.
There is a hugely popular subgenre of science fiction novels called 'Mundane Sci-Fi'.
18th century Austrians preserved their dead by shoving twigs up their bum.
Halfway through the summer, wasps switch from liking ham to liking jam.
